item.title: 独家报道：法国达能集团在欧盟新规实施前淘汰巴西大豆
item.description: 法国乳业巨头达能公司的财务总监告诉路透社，在欧盟要求企业证明没有从毁林地采购大豆的规定出台之前，达能已经停止从巴西采购大豆，现在从亚洲国家采购。【原文：French dairy giant Danone has stopped sourcing soy from Brazil and now buys from countries in Asia, its finance chief told Reuters, ahead of a European Union rule requiring companies to prove they are not sourcing from deforested land.】

item.title: 前沿通信要求股东接受 Verizon 的收购要约
item.description: 前沿通信公司周五敦促股东投票支持威瑞森公司（Verizon）200 亿美元的收购要约，称该公司已审查了其他潜在买家的意向，发现该电信巨头的提议是最有利的选择。【原文：Frontier Communications urged shareholders on Friday to vote for a $20 billion takeover bid from Verizon , saying that it had reviewed interest from other potential buyers and found the telecom giant's proposal as the most favorable option.】

item.title: 中国恒大电动汽车部门停止讨论股权出售事宜
item.description: 中国恒大新能源汽车公司周五表示，其潜在卖家已决定停止出售该公司股份的谈判，该公司是负债累累的中国恒大集团旗下的电动汽车部门。【原文：China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle said on Friday that its potential sellers have decided to cease talks for a stake sale in the company, which is the electric vehicle unit of the debt-laden China Evergrande .】

item.title: 美国法官批准航运公司与司法部就巴尔的摩塌桥事件达成的 1.02 亿美元和解协议
item.description: 今年 3 月，一艘轮船撞击巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥，造成 6 人死亡，该轮船的所有者和运营公司达成了 1.02 亿美元的和解协议。【原文：A U.S. judge on Friday approved a $102 million settlement by the companies that owned and operated the ship that struck Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge in March, killing six people.】

item.title: 汽车经销商团体质疑 Scout Motors 直销美国消费者的决定
item.description: 代表美国汽车经销商的团体周五表示，他们计划对大众汽车旗下 Scout Motors 绕过独立零售商直接向消费者销售的决定提出质疑。【原文：Groups representing U.S. auto dealers said Friday they plan to challenge Volkswagen's Scout Motors decision to sell directly consumers, bypassing independent retailers.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 股票反弹面临科技财报、就业数据和大选的重重考验
item.description: 从下周开始，科技巨头将公布公司业绩，就业报告也将受到密切关注，同时美国大选也将临近。【原文：The rally in U.S. stocks is wobbling as it confronts a stretch of potentially market-shaking events, starting next week with corporate results from tech titans and the closely watched employment report, while the U.S. election is also nearing.】

item.title: 英特尔将投资 280 多亿美元在俄亥俄州建立两家芯片工厂
item.description: 英特尔公司周五表示，将投资 280 多亿美元在俄亥俄州利辛县新建两家芯片工厂，以推进其代工业务扩张计划。【原文：Intel said on Friday it would invest more than $28 billion to construct two new chip factories in Licking County, Ohio, as the company pushes ahead with plans to expand its foundry business.】

item.title: 加拿大 8 月零售销售因汽车销售增长 0.4%，大部分行业销售下降
item.description: 周五的数据显示，由于大部分行业的消费支出出现紧张，加拿大8月份的零售销售额略有增长，但不及预期。【原文：Canada's retail sales in August increased marginally and missed expectations as consumer spending showed strains across majority of sectors, data showed on Friday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯总统纳比乌琳娜谈将利率提高至 21
item.description: 周五，俄罗斯央行行长埃尔维拉-纳比乌琳娜（Elvira Nabiullina）和副行长阿列克谢-扎博特金（Alexei Zabotkin）在新闻发布会上发表讲话，此前央行将关键利率上调至 21%，为 2003 年 2 月以来的最高水平。【原文：Russian Central Bank Governor Elvira Nabiullina and her deputy Alexei Zabotkin addressed a news conference on Friday after the central bank hiked its key rate to 21%, the highest level since February 2003.】

item.title: 财务主管表示，世界银行正准备启动首次债务换发展项目
item.description: 世界银行副行长兼财务主管豪尔赫-法米利亚（Jorge Familiar）告诉路透社记者，世界银行将在几周内首次推出债换发展项目，这家总部位于华盛顿的贷款机构将扩大其工具包，以帮助面临流动性挑战的经济体。【原文：The World Bank will launch its first ever debt-for-development swap within weeks, its Vice President and Treasurer Jorge Familiar told Reuters, as the Washington-based lender expands its toolkit to help economies facing liquidity challenges.】

item.title: 美国 9 月核心资本货物订单超出预期
item.description: 9 月份，美国主要制成品资本货物的新订单增幅超过预期，但第三季度的商业设备支出可能放缓。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods increased more than expected in September, but business spending on equipment likely slowed in the third quarter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，克利街公司从伦敦金属交易所场内交易商西格玛公司挖走金属交易员
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，正在寻求加入伦敦金属交易所（LME）公开喊价交易大厅的美国经纪商 Clear Street 已从 Sigma Broking 挖走了三名金属交易员。【原文：U.S. broker Clear Street, which is seeking membership of the London Metal Exchange's (LME) open outcry trading floor, has poached three metal traders from Sigma Broking, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 需求稳定，高露洁-棕榄公司上调 2024 年业绩预期下限
item.description: 牙膏生产商高露洁-棕榄公司周五上调了全年销售额和利润预期的下限，此前该公司第三季度业绩超出预期，原因是对其高价产品的需求具有弹性。【原文：Toothpaste maker Colgate-Palmolive raised the lower end of its annual sales and profit forecasts on Friday, after beating third-quarter estimates on resilient demand for its high-priced products.】

item.title: 大选临近，美国货币市场基金迎来大量资金流入
item.description: 截至 10 月 23 日的一周内，美国货币市场基金吸引了大量资金流入，原因是美国总统大选的不确定性和对美联储利率前景的重新评估刺激了对更安全资产的需求。【原文：U.S. money market funds attracted substantial inflows in the week to Oct. 23 as uncertainty over the U.S. presidential election and a reassessment of Federal Reserve rate outlook boosted demand for safer assets.】

item.title: 首席执行官表示，美国新关税可能促使 Signify 从中国转移部分生产
item.description: 照明制造商 Signify 首席执行官周五表示，如果公司面临美国新一轮关税，将考虑把部分生产迁出中国。【原文：Lighting maker Signify is considering moving some of its production out of China if the company is confronted with a new round of U.S. tariffs, its chief executive said on Friday.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利下调气候目标，警告过渡缓慢
item.description: 摩根士丹利首席可持续发展官告诉路透社，由于世界向绿色经济发展的步伐过于缓慢，该行已经降低了其企业贷款组合的减排预期。【原文：Morgan Stanley has lowered its expectations for cutting emissions from its corporate lending portfolio as the world is moving too slowly to a greener economy, the bank's chief sustainability officer told Reuters.】

item.title: 市场为为期两周的疯狂选举和利率变动做好准备
item.description: 在美国和日本选举领导人、三大央行决定利率以及英国新政府提交预算的关键两周来临之前，全球投资者纷纷涌入美元，并押注波动会加剧。【原文：Investors globally are piling into the U.S. dollar and betting on rising volatility ahead of a crucial two weeks in which the United States and Japan elect leaders, three major central banks decide on interest rates and the new UK government presents its budget.】

item.title: 瑞银基金管理部门报告持有瑞士国家银行 3% 的股份
item.description: 瑞银基金管理（瑞士）公司（UBS Fund Management (Switzerland) AG）10 月份向瑞士证券交易所提交的文件显示，该公司目前持有瑞士国家银行 3% 的股份。【原文：UBS Fund Management (Switzerland) AG now holds a 3% stake in Swiss National Bank , according to an October filing with the country's SIX stock exchange.】

item.title: 全球货币市场基金因大选引发的谨慎情绪而大量流入
item.description: 在截至10月23日的一周内，全球投资者将大量投资引向了安全的货币市场基金，原因是对即将到来的美国和日本大选持谨慎态度，以及美国利率前景的变化。【原文：Global investors channelised large investments into the safety of money market funds in the week through Oct. 23 on caution over the upcoming elections in the United States and Japan, and the shift in the outlook for U.S. interest rates.】

item.title: HCA 医疗保健公司季度利润不及预期
item.description: HCA Healthcare周五的季度利润不及华尔街预期。【原文：HCA Healthcare missed Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit on Friday.】

item.title: 美国大选在即，2024 年市场狂飙突进
item.description: 日本大选可能会引发下一次市场动荡，在这一年里，世界上一半人口所在的国家都将进行投票。但市场仍在关注美国总统大选，这场选举对投资者和全球领导人来说都是最重要的。【原文：Japan's election could prompt the next market gyrations in a year in which countries housing half the world's population will have voted. But markets remain fixated on the U.S. presidential election - the race that counts most for investors and global leaders alike.】

item.title: 纽约市广播公司报告第三季度亏损，雨天资金增加
item.description: 纽约社区银行（New York Community Bancorp）周五公布了第三季度的亏损报告，因为这家地区性贷款机构预留了更多的准备金以应对潜在的贷款损失。【原文：New York Community Bancorp reported a loss for the third quarter on Friday as the regional lender set aside more reserves to cover potential loan losses.】

item.title: 多伦多证券交易所期货在零售销售数据公布前持平
item.description: 周五，与加拿大主要股指挂钩的期货价格持平，原因是原油价格的上涨被金属价格的下跌所抵消，同时投资者在等待当天晚些时候的国内经济数据。【原文：Futures tied to Canada's main stock index were flat on Friday, as a rise in crude prices was countered by losses in metals, while investors awaited domestic economic data later in the day.】

item.title: 德克斯户外（Deckers Outdoor）因霍卡鞋需求激增而股价大涨
item.description: Deckers Outdoor 在周五的盘前交易中股价大涨约 15%，此前该鞋类制造商上调了年度销售预期，并因需求恢复而超出第二季度预期。【原文：Deckers Outdoor shares jumped about 15% in premarket trading on Friday after the shoemaker raised its annual sales forecast and beat second-quarter expectations, on resilient demand.】

item.title: 大众汽车公司工会主席表示，大众汽车仍未提出品牌未来计划
item.description: 大众汽车集团劳资协议会负责人在一份发给员工的文件中说，大众汽车迄今尚未提出如何使其同名品牌更具竞争力的计划，并补充说管理层仍然只关注劳动力成本。【原文：Volkswagen has so far not presented a plan for how to make its namesake brand more competitive, the head of the group's works council said in a handout to staff, adding management remained solely focused on labour costs.】

item.title: 阿伯克龙比公司前首席执行官杰弗里斯将在性交易案中认罪
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch 的前长期首席执行官迈克-杰弗里斯（Mike Jeffries）被控在领导这家服装零售商期间实施国际性贩卖和卖淫计划，将于周五接受传讯。【原文：Mike Jeffries, the former longtime chief executive of Abercrombie & Fitch , will be arraigned on Friday after being charged with running an international sex trafficking and prostitution scheme while leading the clothing retailer.】

item.title: 国债收益率下降，期货上涨；特斯拉下滑
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货走高，尽管特斯拉下跌，但国债收益率下降为股市提供了一些宽慰，不过三大股指似乎都将出现周线下跌。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Friday, with a decline in Treasury yields offering some relief to equities despite a drop in Tesla, although all three major indexes looked poised for a weekly loss.】

item.title: 医疗保险公司 Centene 凭借商业计划优势实现盈利目标
item.description: Centene 公司周五公布的第三季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，原因是其商业保险业务的优势超过了政府支持的低收入人群医疗补助计划的高成本影响。【原文：Centene beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Friday, as strength in its commercial insurance business outweighed the impact of high costs related to its government-backed Medicaid plans for low-income people.】

item.title: 特朗普憎恨拜登的气候法。他的盟友从中牟利
item.description: 特朗普的亲密盟友中至少有七位是绿色减税的重要受益者。【原文：At least seven of Trump's close allies are significant beneficiaries of green tax breaks.】

item.title: 美国法院阻止卡普里与 Tapestry 85 亿美元的合并案后，卡普里股价暴跌 46
item.description: 迈克尔-科尔斯公司（Michael Kors）的所有者卡普里公司（Capri）的股价在周五的盘前交易中下跌了近 46%，因为美国法官阻止了该公司与手提包制造商 Tapestry 公司（Tapestry.com）即将进行的 85 亿美元的合并。【原文：Shares of Michael Kors owner Capri slumped nearly 46% in premarket trading on Friday after a U.S. judge blocked its pending $8.5 billion merger with handbag maker Tapestry .】
